channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: No Nato for Zelenskyy, Russia's return to G7: Trump’s 28-point plan to end Ukraine war
History Today: Revisiting the burning down of US embassy in Pakistan
PM Modi heads to South Africa for G20: Here is what to look out for
FirstUp: Modi to attend G20 summit in South Africa, Trump to meet Mamdani… The headlines of the day
The US is phasing out the penny. But who wins and who loses?
Months after Oli govt collapse, why is Nepal witnessing Gen-Z protests again?
Amit Shah’s red book: How it engineered the Maoists’ fall and could be a blueprint for ending future insurgencies
item.description: The Modi government’s unprecedented successes against Left-Wing Extremism have shown that insurgencies cannot be fought through development rhetoric alone. They require firm state authority, followed by inclusive development that empowers marginalised communities.

item.title: Arms sale to Taiwan deepens US-China friction as military drills intensify
item.description: While China has warned of serious consequences and may impose sanctions, the US frames the sale as a necessary sustainment measure for existing aircraft rather than an escalation

item.title: Lessons from America’s handling of the exiled Shah: Why India should stand firm on Sheikh Hasina
item.description: To appease Yunus and his Islamist backers would be no more effective than Carter’s appeasement was toward Khomeini with regard to the future trajectory of relations.

item.title: G20 summit in South Africa: How last four presidencies have steered the Global South agenda
item.description: The gains for the Global South have been significant during the last four G20 presidencies and hopefully the momentum will be maintained.

item.title: Congress blames everyone but itself: Voter-list politics masks leadership crisis
item.description: The grand old party is outsourcing excuses for electoral failures instead of introspecting, revealing a leadership that has lost the pulse of the nation

item.title: Exile, extradition and erosion of democracy in Bangladesh: The politics behind Sheikh Hasina’s death sentence
item.description: The recycling of the issues about Sheikh Hasina is engineered to conceal Muhammad Yunus’ incompetence and failure
